description:
Sitobion miscanthi is a species of aphid, a small sap-sucking insect that belongs to the family Aphididae. It is commonly known as the miscanthus aphid or Chinese silvergrass aphid.

Sitobion miscanthi is a greenish-yellow to pale green in color, with a slender, elongated body and a pair of cornicles (small tubular structures) on the rear end. The aphid has a complex life cycle, with both parthenogenetic (asexual) and sexual reproduction phases. During the parthenogenetic phase, the aphid reproduces viviparously, giving birth to live young without the need for fertilization.

This aphid species primarily infests various species of miscanthus (Chinese silvergrass), a genus of perennial grasses native to Asia. The aphids feed on the sap of the plant, which can lead to the development of sooty mold, leaf curling, and reduced plant vigor if the infestation is severe.

Sitobion miscanthi is widely distributed across Asia, including China, Japan, and Korea, where it is considered an agricultural pest of miscanthus crops. It is an important subject of study in the fields of entomology and plant-insect interactions.
